PAD_ShockedByBox.synopsis: Exclamations of pain/shock from the player after the Orpheus box (mysterious gith artefact) gives them a shock (after the try to take it from its current bearer or do other things it doesn't want them to do)

BoxInteraction.synopsis: The player examines a mysterious, ornate box in their possession. If the player is Shadowheart, she'll know she has to take care of this item and get it to Baldur's Gate. The player can also try to discard the box or force it open, but cannot. Companions chime in with their thoughts if present.

LootingBoxFromShadowheart.synopsis: After Shadowheart is killed, the mysterious gith artefact that she retrieved from her nautiloid pod levitates from her corpse and forces itself on the player. The player and companions react. The player is unable to discard the artefact.

PAD_BoxInteraction.synopsis: The player remarks on an ornate, mysterious box. If it's Shadowheart speaking, she knows she has to protect the box and bring it to Baldur's Gate as part of her mission.

PAD_ShadowheartBlock.synopsis: Player uses the box while Shadowheart is in the party and she still isn't willing to share it.
PAD_ShadowheartBlock.how_to_trigger: Recruit Shadowheart and try to use it with any other character while it is in her inventory.

PAD_ShockedByBox_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ShockedByBox_0.context: NodeContext: Exclamation of pain/surprise, like after receiving a smal electric shock.

BoxInteraction_4.speaker: Narrator
BoxInteraction_4.text: *Such a curious artefact. So small and seemingly harmless, and yet it contains so much.*
BoxInteraction_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player pulls puzzle box out of inventory

BoxInteraction_36.speaker: Narrator
BoxInteraction_36.text: *A curious, ornate box. Its many sides are engraved with indecipherable glyphs.*
BoxInteraction_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player pulls puzzle box out of inventory and examines it

BoxInteraction_40.speaker: Narrator
BoxInteraction_40.text: *You look over the box. Strange, ornate - and precious.*
BoxInteraction_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player pulls puzzle box out of inventory

BoxInteraction_45.speaker: Narrator
BoxInteraction_45.text: *You have to protect it. You have to get it to Baldur's Gate. Shar is counting on you.*

BoxInteraction_39.speaker: Narrator
BoxInteraction_39.text: *No openings you can see, yet you sense something inside it.*
BoxInteraction_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player turns the box over in their hands, holds it closer to their face, as if sensing something.

BoxInteraction_32.speaker: Gale
BoxInteraction_32.text: Curious artefact, isn't it? Ancient, beguiling, cryptic - the ABCs of mystery.

BoxInteraction_12.speaker: Astarion
BoxInteraction_12.text: What a pretty thing. I imagine it's dangerous - most pretty things are.

BoxInteraction_28.speaker: Karlach
BoxInteraction_28.text: Huh. There's something about it, isn't there? Can an object have magnetism?

BoxInteraction_6.speaker: Shadowheart
BoxInteraction_6.text: Staring at it won't provide any more answers, unfortunately. There's power to it - that's for certain.

BoxInteraction_0.speaker: Lae'zel
BoxInteraction_0.text: I've seen markings like these. Ancient githyanki inscriptions. Whatever this box, it's significant.

BoxInteraction_14.speaker: Wyll
BoxInteraction_14.text: There's something about that thing - can't keep my eyes off it.

BoxInteraction_44.speaker: Narrator
BoxInteraction_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player tries to find purchase in the box's surfacew and pry it open.

BoxInteraction_10.speaker: Gale
BoxInteraction_10.text: A box that simply refuses to be toyed with. Happens to the best of us.

BoxInteraction_21.speaker: Astarion
BoxInteraction_21.text: Perhaps it needs a magic word? Try 'please'. Or 'sledgehammer'.
BoxInteraction_21.context: NodeContext: Watch player struggle to open a magical box.

BoxInteraction_30.speaker: Karlach
BoxInteraction_30.text: Tough luck. Let me know if you need to borrow a little elbow grease.

BoxInteraction_33.speaker: Shadowheart
BoxInteraction_33.text: It's useless - believe me, I've tried.

BoxInteraction_24.speaker: Lae'zel
BoxInteraction_24.text: Those runes - this object must hold great power. It will not yield to our hands alone.

BoxInteraction_29.speaker: Wyll
BoxInteraction_29.text: Something tells me it'll take more than a few twists to break that box open.

BoxInteraction_27.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The artefact drops to the ground, only to shoot back up into the player's hands and give them a small shock.
SFX: box flies into player's hands, electric/magic shock fx.

BoxInteraction_41.speaker: Gale
BoxInteraction_41.text: Looks like that box has taken a shine to you. So unconditional, isn't it, the affection of inanimate objects?

BoxInteraction_43.speaker: Astarion
BoxInteraction_43.text: Looks like your toy has other ideas. I think you're stuck with it.
BoxInteraction_43.context: NodeContext: Watched player throw away a box only for it to magically return to their hands

BoxInteraction_26.speaker: Shadowheart
BoxInteraction_26.text: There's no getting rid of it. We'll just have to keep it hidden away.

BoxInteraction_17.speaker: Lae'zel
BoxInteraction_17.text: By Vlaakith - we may not forsake it, nor it us.

BoxInteraction_22.speaker: Wyll
BoxInteraction_22.text: What in the - are we stuck with the damn thing?

BoxInteraction_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player puts puzzle box away

LootingBoxFromShadowheart_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Something rises from Shadowheart's corpse - the strange artefact she'd just retrieved. It emits a pulsing glow and rapidly floats into the player's hands

LootingBoxFromShadowheart_13.speaker: Lae'zel
LootingBoxFromShadowheart_13.text: By Vlaakith, what magic is this?

LootingBoxFromShadowheart_21.speaker: Astarion
LootingBoxFromShadowheart_21.text: Well well, it likes you. Whatever the hells it is.

LootingBoxFromShadowheart_17.speaker: Gale
LootingBoxFromShadowheart_17.text: The artefact claims a new owner. So much for mourning the last one.

LootingBoxFromShadowheart_9.speaker: Karlach
LootingBoxFromShadowheart_9.text: Whoa - looks like it found a new friend.

LootingBoxFromShadowheart_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: the player tries to throw the box away, but it flies back into their hands and gives them a shock instead.

LootingBoxFromShadowheart_12.speaker: Lae'zel
LootingBoxFromShadowheart_12.text: By the planes, it is bound to us. A grave portent - or perhaps an encouraging one.
LootingBoxFromShadowheart_12.context: NodeContext: By the planes = I'll be damned sort of thing

LootingBoxFromShadowheart_11.speaker: Wyll
LootingBoxFromShadowheart_11.text: Holy hells. By the looks of it, we're stuck with the damned thing.

LootingBoxFromShadowheart_3.speaker: Astarion
LootingBoxFromShadowheart_3.text: Seems it won't take 'no' for an answer.

LootingBoxFromShadowheart_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player puts the box away.

LootingBoxFromShadowheart_22.speaker: Gale
LootingBoxFromShadowheart_22.text: Persistent, isn't it? Looks like you made a new friend for life.

PAD_BoxInteraction_1.speaker: Player
PAD_BoxInteraction_1.text: The artefact. I have to keep it safe.
